SEARCH
Package com.ilm.projecto_ilm_backend.dao

Class ProjectDao

java.lang.Object
com.ilm.projecto_ilm_backend.dao.AbstractDao<ProjectEntity>
com.ilm.projecto_ilm_backend.dao.ProjectDao
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ProjectDao extends AbstractDao<ProjectEntity>
The ProjectDao class provides database operations for ProjectEntity instances. It extends the AbstractDao class to inherit common database operations.
See Also:

    • merge

      public void merge(ProjectEntity project)
      Merges the state of the given project into the current persistence context.
      Overrides:
      merge in class AbstractDao<ProjectEntity>
      Parameters:
      project - the project to be merged.

    • findById

      public ProjectEntity findById(int id)
      Finds a project by the given id.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the project to be found. The id is unique for each project. It is used to identify the project. It is an integer.

    • getIdBySystemName

      public int getIdBySystemName(String systemName)
      Retrieves the unique identifier of a project based on its system name.
      Parameters:
      systemName - The system name of the project.
      Returns:
      The unique identifier of the project or -1 if no project is found.

    • findAllNamesAndDescriptionsHome

      public ArrayList<HomeProjectDto> findAllNamesAndDescriptionsHome()
      Retrieves a list of projects suitable for display on the home page. This includes basic project information such as names and descriptions.
      Returns:
      A list of HomeProjectDto objects containing project names and descriptions.

    • getProjectTableDtoInfo

      public List<Object[]> getProjectTableDtoInfo(int page, int projectsPerPage, LabEntity lab, StateProjectENUM status, boolean slotsAvailable, String nameAsc, String statusAsc, String labAsc, String startDateAsc, String endDateAsc, String keyword)
      Retrieves project information for display in a paginated project table. This method allows filtering and sorting based on various project attributes.
      Parameters:
      page - The page number for pagination.
      projectsPerPage - The number of projects to display per page.
      lab - The lab entity to filter projects by.
      status - The project status to filter projects by.
      slotsAvailable - A flag indicating whether to filter projects by available slots.
      nameAsc - A flag indicating whether to sort projects by name in ascending order.
      statusAsc - A flag indicating whether to sort projects by status in ascending order.
      labAsc - A flag indicating whether to sort projects by lab in ascending order.
      startDateAsc - A flag indicating whether to sort projects by start date in ascending order.
      endDateAsc - A flag indicating whether to sort projects by end date in ascending order.
      keyword - A keyword to filter projects by.
      Returns:
      A list of Object arrays containing project information.

    • getMyProjectsDtoInfo

      public List<Object[]> getMyProjectsDtoInfo(int page, int projectsPerPage, LabEntity lab, StateProjectENUM status, String keyword, int userId, UserInProjectTypeENUM type)
      Retrieves information about projects associated with a specific user. This method supports filtering, sorting, and pagination.
      Parameters:
      page - The page number for pagination.
      projectsPerPage - The number of projects to display per page.
      lab - The lab entity to filter projects by.
      status - The project status to filter projects by.
      keyword - A keyword to filter projects by.
      userId - The unique identifier of the user.
      type - The type of user involvement in the project to filter by.
      Returns:
      A list of Object arrays containing project information.

    • getSkillsBySystemName

      public List<String> getSkillsBySystemName(String projectSystemName)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • isSkillInProject

      public boolean isSkillInProject(String projectSystemName, String skillName)
      Checks if a specific skill is associated with a project identified by its system name.
      Parameters:
      projectSystemName - The system name of the project.
      skillName - The name of the skill to check.
      Returns:
      true if the skill is associated with the project, false otherwise.

    • doesProjectExists

      public boolean doesProjectExists(String name)
      Checks if a project with the given name exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the project to check.
      Returns:
      true if a project with the given name exists, false otherwise.
